slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः | स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī bhagavān uvācha | anāśhritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryaṁ karma karoti yaḥ | sa sannyāsī cha yogī cha na niragnir na chākriyaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: One who performs their prescribed duties without seeking the fruits of their actions is a true renunciant and yogi, not the one who has merely renounced all activities or the sacred fire.

slokas.sanskrit: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव | न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ||
slokas.pronunciation: yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍava | na hy asannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaśhchana ||
slokas.meaning: What is known as renunciation, know that to be yoga, O Pandava (Arjuna). No one can become a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.

slokas.sanskrit: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते | योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: ārurukṣhor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyate | yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śhamaḥ kāraṇam uchyate ||
slokas.meaning: For one who is aspiring to ascend to yoga, action is said to be the means; for one who has already ascended to yoga, tranquility is said to be the means.

slokas.sanskrit: यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते | सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: yadā hi nendriyārtheṣhu na karmasv-anuṣhajjate | sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadochyate ||
slokas.meaning: When one is neither attached to sense objects nor to actions, having renounced all selfish desires, then they are said to have ascended to yoga.

slokas.sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् | आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet | ātmaiva hy ātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: One should elevate oneself through the mind, not degrade oneself. The mind alone is one's friend as well as one's enemy.

slokas.sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः | अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ||
slokas.pronunciation: bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ | anātmanas tu śhatrutve vartetātmaiva śhatru-vat ||
slokas.meaning: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; but for one who has failed to do so, the mind will remain the greatest enemy.

slokas.sanskrit: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः | शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ||
slokas.pronunciation: jitātmanaḥ praśhāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ | śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ ||
slokas.meaning: The yogi whose mind is controlled remains steadfast in meditation on the Self, and is undisturbed by dualities such as cold and heat, pleasure and pain, and honor and dishonor.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः | युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: jñāna-vijñāna-tṛiptātmā kūṭa-stho vijitendriyaḥ | yukta ityuchyate yogī sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: A person is said to be established in self-realization and is called a yogi [or mystic] when they are fully satisfied by virtue of acquired knowledge and realization. Such a person is situated in transcendence and is self-controlled. They see everything—whether it be pebbles, stones, or gold—as the same.

slokas.sanskrit: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु | साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: su-hṛin-mitrāry-udāsīna-madhyastha-dveṣhya-bandhuṣhu | sādhuṣhv api cha pāpeṣhu sama-buddhir viśhiṣhyate ||
slokas.meaning: One who is impartial to friends, companions, and enemies, who is neutral in honor and dishonor, heat and cold, happiness and distress, fame and infamy, who is always free from contaminating association, always silent and satisfied with anything, who doesn't care for any residence, who is fixed in knowledge and engaged in devotional service, is very dear to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः | एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ||
slokas.pronunciation: yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṁ rahasi sthitaḥ | ekākī yata-chittātmā nirāśhīr aparigrahaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: A yogi should always try to concentrate their mind on the Supreme Self; they should live alone in a secluded place and should always carefully control their mind. They should be free from desires and possessiveness.

slokas.sanskrit: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः | नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhuchau deśhe pratiṣhṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ | nāty-uchchhritaṁ nātinīchaṁ chailājina-kuśhottaram ||
slokas.meaning: To practice yoga, one should go to a secluded place and lay kusha grass on the ground and then cover it with a deerskin and a soft cloth. The seat should be neither too high nor too low.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः | उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ||
slokas.pronunciation: tatraikāgraṁ manaḥ kṛitvā yata-chittendriya-kriyaḥ | upaviśhyāsane yuñjyād yogam ātma-viśhuddhaye ||
slokas.meaning: Sitting there on the seat, one should practice yoga by controlling the mind and senses, purifying the heart and fixing the mind on one point.

slokas.sanskrit: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः | सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ||
slokas.pronunciation: samaṁ kāya-śhiro-grīvaṁ dhārayann achalaṁ sthiraḥ | samprekṣhya nāsikāgraṁ svaṁ diśhaśh chānavalokayan ||
slokas.meaning: One should hold one's body, neck, and head erect in a straight line and stare steadily at the tip of the nose. Thus, with an unagitated, subdued mind, devoid of fear, completely free from sex life, one should meditate upon Me within the heart and make Me the ultimate goal of life.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः | मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ||
slokas.pronunciation: praśhāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahmachāri-vrate sthitaḥ | manaḥ sanyamya mach-chitto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Thus, with a serene mind, fearless, established in the vow of celibacy, and controlling the mind, one should meditate on Me, making Me the supreme goal.

slokas.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः | शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमं मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation: yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī niyata-mānasaḥ | śhāntiṁ nirvāṇa-paramāṁ mat-sansthām adhigachchhati ||
slokas.meaning: Thus practicing constant control of the body, mind and activities, the mystic transcendentalist, his mind regulated, attains to the kingdom of God [the abode of Krishna] by cessation of material existence.

slokas.sanskrit: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः | न चाति स्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ||
slokas.pronunciation: nātyaśhnatas tu yogo 'sti na chaikāntam anaśhnataḥ | na chāti-svapna-śhīlasya jāgrato naiva chārjuna ||
slokas.meaning: O Arjuna, yoga is not possible for one who eats too much or too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or too little.

slokas.sanskrit: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु | युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ||
slokas.pronunciation: yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-cheṣhṭasya karmasu | yukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā ||
slokas.meaning: But for one who is moderate in eating and recreation, balanced in work, and regulated in sleep and wakefulness, the practice of yoga destroys all sorrows.

slokas.sanskrit: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते | निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ||
slokas.pronunciation: yadā viniyataṁ chittam ātmanyevāvatiṣhṭhate | niḥspṛihaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ityuchyate tadā ||
slokas.meaning: When the disciplined mind is established in the Self alone, free from longing for all material desires, then one is said to be established in yoga.

slokas.sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता | योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: yathā dīpo nivāta-stho neṅgate sopamā smṛitā | yogino yata-chittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: As a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so the disciplined mind of a yogi remains steady in meditation on the Self.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया | यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ||
slokas.pronunciation: yatroparamate chittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayā | yatra chaivātmanātmānaṁ paśhyann ātmani tuṣhyati ||
slokas.meaning: When the mind, restrained by the practice of yoga, attains quietness, and when seeing the Self by the self, one is satisfied in the Self.

slokas.sanskrit: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् | वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ||
slokas.pronunciation: sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam | vetti yatra na chaivāyaṁ sthitaśh chalati tattvataḥ ||
slokas.meaning: In that state of yoga, one experiences infinite happiness that is perceived through the transcendental senses and is beyond ordinary sensory consciousness. Established thus, one never deviates from the truth.

slokas.sanskrit: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः | यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: yaṁ labdhvā chāparaṁ lābhaṁ manyate nādhikaṁ tataḥ | yasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vichālyate ||
slokas.meaning: Upon gaining this, one thinks there is no greater gain. Being situated in such a position, one is never shaken, even in the midst of greatest difficulty.

slokas.sanskrit: तं विद्याद् दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसञ्ज्ञितम् | स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ||
slokas.pronunciation: taṁ vidyād duḥkha-saṁyoga-viyogaṁ yoga-sañjñitam | sa niśhchayena yoktavyo yogo 'nirviṇṇa-chetasā ||
slokas.meaning: Know that state of severance from union with suffering to be known as yoga. This yoga should be practiced with determination and an undaunted mind.

slokas.sanskrit: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः | मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ||
slokas.pronunciation: saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāṁs tyaktvā sarvān aśheṣhataḥ | manasaivendriya-grāmaṁ viniyamya samantataḥ ||
slokas.meaning: Abandoning without reserve all material desires born of mental speculation, and completely restraining the whole group of senses by the mind from all sides.

slokas.sanskrit: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद् बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया | आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhanaiḥ śhanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛiti-gṛihītayā | ātma-saṁsthaṁ manaḥ kṛitvā na kiñchid api chintayet ||
slokas.meaning: Gradually, step by step, one should become situated in trance by means of intelligence sustained by full conviction, and thus the mind should be fixed on the Self alone and should think of nothing else.

slokas.sanskrit: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् | ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ||
slokas.pronunciation: yato yato niśhcharati manaśh chañchalam asthiram | tatas tato niyamyaitad ātmanyeva vaśhaṁ nayet ||
slokas.meaning: From wherever the mind wanders due to its flickering and unsteady nature, one must certainly withdraw it and bring it back under the control of the Self.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् | उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: praśhānta-manasaṁ hyenaṁ yoginaṁ sukham uttamam | upaiti śhānta-rajasaṁ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣham ||
slokas.meaning: The yogi whose mind is peaceful, whose passions are calmed, who is free from sin and has become one with Brahman, attains the highest bliss.

slokas.sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः | सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ||
slokas.pronunciation: yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣhaḥ | sukhena brahma-sansparśham atyantaṁ sukham aśhnute ||
slokas.meaning: By constantly engaging in this way in the practice of yoga, the yogi who is freed from all impurities experiences the highest bliss of intimate contact with Brahman.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि | ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmani | īkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ ||
slokas.meaning: A true yogi sees Me in all beings and also sees every being in Me. Indeed, the self-realized person sees Me everywhere.

slokas.sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति | तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ||
slokas.pronunciation: yo māṁ paśhyati sarvatra sarvaṁ cha mayi paśhyati | tasyāhaṁ na praṇaśhyāmi sa cha me na praṇaśhyati ||
slokas.meaning: For one who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost, nor is he ever lost to Me.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः | सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ||
slokas.pronunciation: sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajatyekatvam āsthitaḥ | sarvathā vartamāno 'pi sa yogī mayi vartate ||
slokas.meaning: The yogi who is established in oneness and worships Me as dwelling in all beings lives in Me, regardless of his mode of living.

slokas.sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन | सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ||
slokas.pronunciation: ātmaupamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśhyati yo 'rjuna | sukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ ||
slokas.meaning: O Arjuna, that yogi who sees the happiness and distress of all beings as equal by comparison to their own self is considered to be the highest.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन | एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: arjuna uvācha | yo 'yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana | etasyāhaṁ na paśhyāmi chañchalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām ||
slokas.meaning: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, the system of yoga which you have summarized appears impractical and unendurable to me, for the mind is restless and unsteady.

slokas.sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् | तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: chañchalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛiṣhṇa pramāthi balavad dṛiḍham | tasyāhaṁ nigrahaṁ manye vāyor iva su-duṣhkaram ||
slokas.meaning: For the mind is restless, turbulent, obstinate and very strong, O Krishna, and to subdue it, I think, is more difficult than controlling the wind.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् | अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī bhagavān uvācha | asanśhayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ chalam | abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa cha gṛihyate ||
slokas.meaning: The Blessed Lord said: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, it is undoubtedly very difficult to curb the restless mind, but it is possible by constant practice and detachment.

slokas.sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः | वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ||
slokas.pronunciation: asaṁyatātmanā yogo duṣhprāpa iti me matiḥ | vaśhyātmanā tu yatatā śhakyo 'vāptum upāyataḥ ||
slokas.meaning: For one whose mind is unbridled, self-realization is difficult work. But for one whose mind is controlled and who strives by appropriate means, it is possible to achieve. This is My opinion.

slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः | अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation: arjuna uvācha | ayatiḥ śhraddhayopeto yogāch chalita-mānasaḥ | aprāpya yoga-sansiddhiṁ kāṁ gatiṁ kṛiṣhṇa gachchhati ||
slokas.meaning: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the destination of the unsuccessful transcendentalist who in the beginning takes to the process of self-realization with faith but who later desists due to worldly-mindedness and thus does not attain perfection in mysticism?

slokas.sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति | अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ||
slokas.pronunciation: kachchin nobhaya-vibhraṣhṭaśh chhinnābhram iva naśhyati | apratiṣhṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi ||
slokas.meaning: O mighty-armed Krishna, does not such a person, being deviated from the path of Transcendence, perish like a riven cloud, with no position in any sphere?

slokas.sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः | त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: etan me sanśhayaṁ kṛiṣhṇa chhettum arhasyaśheṣhataḥ | tvad-anyaḥ sanśhayasyāsya chhettā na hyupapadyate ||
slokas.meaning: This is my doubt, O Krishna, and I ask You to dispel it completely. For none other than You can destroy this doubt.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते | न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī bhagavān uvācha | pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśhas tasya vidyate | na hi kalyāṇa-kṛit kaśhchid durgatiṁ tāta gachchhati ||
slokas.meaning: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, there is no destruction for him either in this world or in the next. One who does good, My friend, is never overcome by evil.

slokas.sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः | शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ||
slokas.pronunciation: prāpya puṇya-kṛitāṁ lokān uṣhitvā śhāśhvatīḥ samāḥ | śhuchīnāṁ śhrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣhṭo 'bhijāyate ||
slokas.meaning: The unsuccessful yogi, after attaining the planets of the pious and dwelling there for many years, is born into a family of righteous people, or into a family of rich aristocracy.

slokas.sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् | एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: athavā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām | etad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛiśham ||
slokas.meaning: Or he takes his birth in a family of transcendentalists who are surely great in wisdom. Verily, such a birth is rare in this world.

slokas.sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् | यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ||
slokas.pronunciation: tatra taṁ buddhi-saṁyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam | yatate cha tato bhūyaḥ sansiddhau kuru-nandana ||
slokas.meaning: On taking such a birth, he revives the divine consciousness of his previous life, and he again tries to make further progress in order to achieve complete success, O son of Kuru.

slokas.sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः | जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ||
slokas.pronunciation: pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hyavaśho 'pi saḥ | jijñāsur api yogasya śhabda-brahmātivartate ||
slokas.meaning: By virtue of the divine consciousness of his previous life, he automatically becomes attracted to the yogic principles – even without seeking them. Such an inquisitive transcendentalist stands always above the ritualistic principles of the scriptures.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः | अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī sanśhuddha-kilbiṣhaḥ | aneka-janma-sansiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim ||
slokas.meaning: And when the yogi engages himself with sincere endeavor in making further progress, being washed of all contaminations, then ultimately, achieving perfection after many, many births of practice, he attains the supreme goal.

slokas.sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः | कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ||
slokas.pronunciation: tapasvibhyo 'dhiko yogī jñānibhyo 'pi mato 'dhikaḥ | karmibhyaśh chādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna ||
slokas.meaning: A yogi is greater than the ascetic, greater than the empiricist and greater than the fruitive worker. Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi.

slokas.sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना | श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ||
slokas.pronunciation: yoginām api sarveṣhāṁ mad-gatenāntar-ātmanā | śhraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ ||
slokas.meaning: And of all yogis, the one who always abides in Me with great faith, worshiping Me in transcendental loving service, is most intimately united with Me in yoga and is the highest of all.
